DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not prednisone was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A synthetic glucocorticoid with anti-inflammatory and immunomodulating properties.  After cell surface receptor attachment and cell entry, prednisone enters the nucleus where it binds to and activates specific nuclear receptors, resulting in an altered gene expression and inhibition of proinflammatory cytokine production.  This agent also decreases the number of circulating lymphocytes, induces cell differentiation, and stimulates apoptosis in sensitive tumor cells populations. (NCI04)_The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A synthetic glucocorticoid with anti-inflammatory and immunomodulating properties.  After cell surface receptor attachment and cell entry, prednisone enters the nucleus where it binds to and activates specific nuclear receptors, resulting in an altered gene expression and inhibition of proinflammatory cytokine production.  This agent also decreases the number of circulating lymphocytes, induces cell differentiation, and stimulates apoptosis in sensitive tumor cells populations. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: A synthetic glucocorticoid with anti-inflammatory and immunomodulating properties.  After cell surface receptor attachment and cell entry, prednisone enters the nucleus where it binds to and activates specific nuclear receptors, resulting in an altered gene expression and inhibition of proinflammatory cytokine production.  This agent also decreases the number of circulating lymphocytes, induces cell differentiation, and stimulates apoptosis in sensitive tumor cell populations.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.changeDescription: . Modified def to preferred def per caDSR meeting. No versioning needed. AK 2/8/16

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient taken more than the equivalent of 0.5mg/kg per day of Prednisone, in the two weeks prior to Reporting Period end date?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CCRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient taken more than the equivalent of 0.5mg/kg per day of Prednisone,  within 7 days of any LMP-TC administration or during Courses LMP-TC1 or LMP-TC2?

DataElement.changeDescription: . Added human readable def. System generated def displayed as alt def. No version needed. AK 10/13/14
